intro: Wahlenbergia papuana, commonly known as the Papuan bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Papua New Guinea. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom throughout the year. Wahlenbergia papuana is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
